strong.span: Beggs Indian Education needs your help to determine the best way to service our students. We are asking parents of American Indian students to complete this survey. Only one survey per family needs to be submitted. Deadline for submission is
. If you have any questions, please contact Ms. Priscilla Johnson, Program Director, at
. Thank you for your time. Click link below to access the survey.

ol.li: FCC agreement stating that providers will waive late fees, not cutoff service for lack of payment, and open hot-spots.
Comcast COVID-19 response: offers free WiFi for 2 months to low income families plus all Xfinity hot-spots are free to the public during this time

li.a: Charter Free Internet offer for 2 months

ol.li: AT&T COVID-19 response: offers open hot-spots, unlimited data to existing customers, and $10/month plans to low income families
Verizon COVID-19 response: no special offers, but following the FCC agreement.

Sprint COVID-19 response: follows FCC agreement, provides unlimited data to existing customers, and, starting Tuesday, 3/17/2020, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge (I expect others will follow).

T-Mobile COVID-19 response: follows FCC agreement, plus unlimited data to existing customers, and, coming soon, will allow all handsets to enable hot-spots for 60 days at no extra charge (I expect others will follow

div.div: Both Beggs High School BPA teams were finalists at the year’s state convention!!
BES Spelling Bee Champion-Mallory Karbowski Runner-up-Demetrius Olden Click for more photos and winners
2020 Elementary Challenge Bowl. Beggs Black took home the Wilbur Gouge Honors Team Trophy for the best team sportsmanship displayed throughout the competition
BMS Student of the month winners for February Back row Caleb Ayden Libby Front row Nick Zander Allee Ella
Additional BMS Student of the Month Destiny
Challenge Bowl 2020 The Beggs Black team was awarded the esteemed Wilbur Gouge Honors Team Trophy for their sportsmanship and overall respectfulness exhibited during the day.
Beggs No Names fought their way through the losers’ bracket to take home second place in a close matchup with Glenpool Hotvlkvlke, who would win the overall contest. Challenge Bowl 2020

div.div: Congrats to Easton Davis, Matthew Pierce, and Dusty Pendergrass for making the Oklahoma Coaches Association’s 2A All-Star Team! Matthew Pierce was also chosen to OCA All-State Team and will play in the All-State Game!
Congratulation to Kendal Daniels for being recognized as a member of The Oklahoman All-State Team!
So proud of these young men!! Today we took the opportunity to congratulate them on signing to play college football. Easton and Matthew.
